snippet.textDisplay: Who said Lizzo was unhealthy?  Stop, it Tam!  That lady is out there EVERY NIGHT doing a two-hour show dancing, twerking, flipping and playing the flute.  Unless she had a strong heart and cardiovascular system, that would NEVAH be happening.   OAN, skinny does not equate to healthy.  Stop letting Hollyweird brainwash y'all.  Many of those people are thin because they smoke cigarettes to cut their appetite and engage in many other unhealthy habits.

snippet.textDisplay: Idk if this will come out right, but arguments about other people being unhealthy too comes off exactly like the "alllivesmatter/blacklivesmatter" issue. By saying "everyone can be unhealthy" you are downplaying the fact that what we are specifically speaking about, which is obesity and overweight people are at a much higher risk for health issues than anyone else in general. It doesn't solve anything by pointing fingers elsewhere to compare

snippet.textDisplay: I will say this season especially with Amanda being on the show is one of the most entertaining... I like seeing disagreement.. I don't want to just see the same opinions on things... So whilst I don't agree with Loni I like how there's a difference in opinion!!!! It's called the real! For a reason... All the ladies don't have to be the same and in agreement on every topic.. I like seeing debates and I like seeing perspective.... It makes the show more interesting and diverse.. don't be afraid to be the unpopular opinion. I really want to see a topic on religious or philosophical beliefs amongst the hosts.. NOW THAT WOULD BE INTERESTING!

snippet.textDisplay: No one is saying that Lizzo needs to become a size 0 or 2 or 4, you guys are assuming that. Loni literally is part of WEIGHT WATCHERS...watching your weight LOL makes no sense. Lizzo is great, but she should lose weight for her own good to decrease chances of all of these diseases. Of course she can still get them. Many diseases come from genetics, poort diets, and whatever other factor but why not do the best you can to be precautious?! That's all it's about. She now has the funds and access to nutritionists, gyms, coaches and more. She has more than enough resources to help her if she chose to. She seems to be attached this notion of being obese and famous and that's not necessary, her talent is more than enough to keep her relevant even if she shed a few pounds. Jeannie is heavier than ever before, but it's muscle mass...Lizzo can do the same thing.
snippet.textOriginal: No one is saying that Lizzo needs to become a size 0 or 2 or 4, you guys are assuming that. Loni literally is part of WEIGHT WATCHERS...watching your weight LOL makes no sense. snippet.textDisplay: honestly idk who this jillian woman is. she should’ve kept her mouth shut. i understand public health is important. putting your own personal attitudes towards it is not helping. it fuels fire to the fire. giving straight up facts and saying ‘this is what the statistics are. this is what can happen in the future. people (not JUST lizzo) need to take care of themselves and be more conscious of their health’. thin people don’t get that criticism. only in extreme cases where you can tell something is wrong. jfc. i’m thin and i have an iron deficiency. everyone tells me i look good when in reality if i lose blood i will faint. and fainting is not fun. it’s uncomfortable. at face value people don’t know i have that problem and they make assumptions that i’m ‘healthy’ because i don’t have fat.
snippet.textOriginal: honestly idk who this jillian woman is. she should’ve kept her mouth shut. i understand public health is important. putting your own personal attitudes towards it is not helping. it fuels fire to the fire. giving straight up facts and saying ‘this is what the statistics are. this is what can happen in the future. people (not JUST lizzo) need to take care of themselves and be more conscious of their health’. thin people don’t get that criticism. only in extreme cases where you can tell something is wrong. jfc. i’m thin and i have an iron deficiency. everyone tells me i look good when in reality if i lose blood i will faint. and fainting is not fun. it’s uncomfortable. at face value people don’t know i have that problem and they make assumptions that i’m ‘healthy’ because i don’t have fat.

snippet.textDisplay:
Disclaimer: I am a Latino so I’m not trying to be racist

I don’t like the fact that loni and Amanda make everything about race. I love loni but she and Amanda our race into the mix all the time. Lizzo was mentioned in the interview because I saw it and Jillian said the truth. She didn’t say it in the most kind words but she said it. Adele was body shamed and that’s messed up because that’s like saying Adele got no hate yet you speak about supporting women but that’s controversial because your not acknowledged someone else’s hurt. Also being overweight or obese is not healthy. I’m and overweight person that could get diabetes and I know it’s not healthy. My doctors the same as my family want the best for me so when my mom tells me I’m overweight and I have to loose it that is the truth I need to hear it. Now In days we sugar code being obese and it’s wrong. If we love this singer so much which Jillian said she loved her music we shouldn’t applaud unhealthy habits.
snippet.textOriginal:
Disclaimer: I am a Latino so I’m not trying to be racist 

 I don’t like the fact that loni and Amanda make everything about race. I love loni but she and Amanda our race into the mix all the time. Adele was body shamed and that’s messed up because that’s like saying Adele got no hate yet you speak about supporting women but that’s controversial because your not acknowledged someone else’s hurt. Also being overweight or obese is not healthy. I’m and overweight person that could get diabetes and I know it’s not healthy. My doctors the same as my family want the best for me so when my mom tells me I’m overweight and I have to loose it that is the truth I need to hear it. Now In days we sugar code being obese and it’s wrong. If we love this singer so much which Jillian said she loved her music we shouldn’t applaud unhealthy habits.

snippet.textDisplay:
Going to preface this by saying I love Amanda, Loni and all of the ladies on the Real - but it's NOT always about race. Jillian said what she said and I'm certain her remarks about the ramifications of obesity had nothing to do with the fact that Lizzo is a black woman. Believe it or not folks, people are not always trying to conjure up ways to attack black women.

Signed,
A Black Woman

snippet.textDisplay:
Why does everything have to be black
Or white. Can’t we just be about colors?!! Can’t we just stop comparing. Not everything has to be racial. There are blacks people , Hispanics that are racist as well. I was once called a border crossing wet bag by a black person and you know what I didn’t care because I know who I am. It hurt but I know it’s a disease that affects anyone of any color. So let’s just stop pretending that racism happens only with whites. It happens in every single race blue white yellow black green. I don’t think Jillian Michaels meant any harm, I think her approach was not done the right way. I’m a nurse and health is very important and what you eat has consequences later in life. But it’s also mental health as well and it should start there. Il
snippet.textOriginal:
Why does everything have to be black
Or white. Can’t we just be about colors?!! Can’t we just stop comparing. Not everything has to be racial. There are blacks people , Hispanics that are racist as well. I was once called a border crossing wet bag by a black person and you know what I didn’t care because I know who I am. It hurt but I know it’s a disease that affects anyone of any color. So let’s just stop pretending that racism happens only with whites. It happens in every single race blue white yellow black green. I don’t think Jillian Michaels meant any harm, I think her approach was not done the right way. I’m a nurse and health is very important and what you eat has consequences later in life. But it’s also mental health as well and it should start there. Il

snippet.textDisplay:
Generally, especially in media, it's become common to criticize big people the moment you see them. The stigma around the bigger people is that they must be miserable and lazy and people immediately mention diabetes, death and what not when they see them.

Lizzo is the exact opposite of that. She is a good example that being bigger you can be cheerful, energetic and talented. She can sing her lungs out, dance, play flute, all while having amazing breath control. All Lizzo is doing is disproving the notions generally prescribed to bigger people.

We CAN talk about people of different sizes and their talents WITHOUT having to bring their health into it all the time. Jillian could've said she was talented and kept it at that.

snippet.textDisplay: I just think it’s funny that everyone feels the need to become a health expert when they see someone overweight. You’re not coming from a place of empathy, you’re coming from a place of privilege in society (the privilege of not being overweight). The privilege of not knowing how it feels to automatically be judged because of your LIKELIHOOD of getting [insert chronic disease]. And yes you may have been “fat” before but you will still not know how it feels anymore than a rich person who’s worked their way to the top and now sees anyone that is poor as lazy. It’s the same effect. Instead of casting shame on overweight people, you should encourage them to love their selves. That’s what we do. Leave the professional opinions, not even to the professionals, but to THEIR professionals. It’s between them and THEIR healthcare providers. Not someone who doesn’t know their life, like me, you or Jillian. - Sincerely, a person in healthcare.

snippet.textDisplay:
I don't see what the issue in what she said. A Dr. would say the same thing. Everyone makes Lizzo's size an issue or a distinction to propel her success. Why can't she just be extremely talented? I think Jillian was saying, why not celebrate her talent not her size like everyone else does. Bill O'Riley said Beyonce is an icon because of her body and everyone was in an uproar as well. Comments made about Nicki Minaj and Cardi B' body being their only hook to success while it's trending. So are we celebrating talent or the fact that talent has to look a certain way in order to be perceived as talented?
I agree Jullian's comment came off insentive to the masses but its a fact. Others spoke on unsafe body augmentations for validation but no one is blowing it up like this topic.
Lizzo is a talented, beautiful, and strong woman. She doesn't need to be treated as if she has super thin skin, weak minded, and needs to handled like a fragile piece of glass. It's society that does that not Lizzo. She is living her best life the way she wants to very unapologetically. So why not let her do that and stop being offended on her behalf unsolicited

snippet.textDisplay: Stop sugarcoating it. Obesity is the number one cause of death (CVD, CANCER, AUTOIMMUNE DISEASES). Also, thin athletes that drop dead due to heart attacks are due to congenital heart diseases (statistically) meaning that regardless of their weight they will unfortunately suffer from these heart attacks. People think fat is just a few extra pounds when in reality it’s a bunch of active cells that secrete hormones and harmful substances (cytokines and inflammatory markers) that damage our body! Get healthy everyone. Below is an expert form an article from the Journal of Diabetes: The frequency of heart failure is increasing; it is one of the major causes of death globally with a prevalence of approximately 3% in developed countries [20]. A close correlation can be observed between heart failure and obesity. According to data from the Framingham Heart Study, the rise of BMI by 1 kg/m2 increases the risk of heart failure by 5% in the case of men and 7% in the case of women [21]. Studies on heart failure show that 32%–49% of patients suffering from heart failure are obese and 31%–40% are overweight. In the case of obese and overweight patients, heart failure develops 10 years earlier than in the case of subjects with a normal BMI. The duration of morbid obesity is closely correlated to the development of heart failure: after 20 years of obesity, the prevalence of heart failure grows by 70% and after 30 years, the prevalence rises by 90% [22]. The significance of obesity is indicated by the fact that the Framingham Heart Study emphasized the pathogenic role of obesity for the development of heart failure in 11% of males and 14% of females [21].
snippet.textOriginal: Stop sugarcoating it. Obesity is the number one cause of death (CVD, CANCER, AUTOIMMUNE DISEASES). Also, thin athletes that drop dead due to heart attacks are due to congenital heart diseases (statistically) meaning that regardless of their weight they will unfortunately suffer from these heart attacks. People think fat is just a few extra pounds when in reality it’s a bunch of active cells that secrete hormones and harmful substances (cytokines and inflammatory markers) that damage our body! Get healthy everyone. Below is an expert form an article from the Journal of Diabetes: The frequency of heart failure is increasing; it is one of the major causes of death globally with a prevalence of approximately 3% in developed countries [20]. A close correlation can be observed between heart failure and obesity. According to data from the Framingham Heart Study, the rise of BMI by 1 kg/m2 increases the risk of heart failure by 5% in the case of men and 7% in the case of women [21]. Studies on heart failure show that 32%–49% of patients suffering from heart failure are obese and 31%–40% are overweight. In the case of obese and overweight patients, heart failure develops 10 years earlier than in the case of subjects with a normal BMI. The duration of morbid obesity is closely correlated to the development of heart failure: after 20 years of obesity, the prevalence of heart failure grows by 70% and after 30 years, the prevalence rises by 90% [22]. The significance of obesity is indicated by the fact that the Framingham Heart Study emphasized the pathogenic role of obesity for the development of heart failure in 11% of males and 14% of females [21].

snippet.textDisplay: No one should be body shamed and it's important to love and celebrate yourself no matter what. We also need to be cognizant of the fact that weight is an important factor in determining health. That is why our first lady, Michelle Obama's platform was combating obesity in children, In my life I have been severely underweight and after my daughter I gained a lot of weight. I knew I had to create a balance with exercise and eating right. Of course we all have stress factors or physical issues such as our thyroid, which can affect our weight. I believe that Jillian Michaels could have been more compassionate in her wording, but her concern is legitimate. We all love Lizzo and loving someone also means being honest. I am happy Tamera told the truth.
snippet.textOriginal: No one should be body shamed and it's important to love and celebrate yourself no matter what. We also need to be cognizant of the fact that weight is an important factor in determining health. That is why our first lady, Michelle Obama's platform was combating obesity in children, In my life I have been severely underweight and after my daughter I gained a lot of weight. I knew I had to create a balance with exercise and eating right. Of course we all have stress factors or physical issues such as our thyroid, which can affect our weight. I believe that Jillian Michaels could have been more compassionate in her wording, but her concern is legitimate. We all love Lizzo and loving someone also means being honest. I am happy Tamera told the truth.
